description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: EC3 dpram(Err$$d sig=$$s): invalid WADO to WAD connection, comp '$$s'\n
Comp is on a DQS site can't find in our records
chipcheck: IDDRX2 in comp $$s has different signals $$s on port ECLKDQSR and $$s on port ECLK.
chipcheck: IDDRX comp $$s has two clocks driven by one signal $$s on ECLKDQSR and CLK, the use of general routing on the following section(s) $$s may generated uncovered timing skew.
dqs_pinid is $$d while DQSI is $$d
chipcheck: LVDS output pio comp $$s is used as DQS pad but is not placed on a site supports LVDS output.
chipcheck: Below LVDS output pio comp(s): $$s used as DQS pad can not find enough LVDS output site(s) to be placed.
chipcheck: PIO comp $$s connects to DQS comp $$s, but it is placed on PIO site $$s that has no DQS connections.
chipcheck: comp $$s can only be placed on PIO sites $$s that have dedicated connections to DQS $$s, but now is located on $$s site.
chipcheck: comps $$s have connectivity problem: they are placed around one DQS group on site $$s, but are connected to different DQS groups.
chipcheck: CLK pin on DQSIOL comp $$s and SCLK pin on DQS comp $$s have different programming.

chipcheck: The ODDRXD primitive in comp $$s is not driven by DQSBUFG, yet its DQCLK1 port is not driven any signal either.
chipcheck: The ODDRXD primitive in comp $$s not driven by any DQSBUFG should tie DQCLK1 to CLK ports, yet it has signal $$s on DQCLK1 and $$s on CLK
chipcheck: The ODDRXD primitive in comp $$s side cannot tie DQCLK1 and CLK ports, yet it has signal $$s on both DQCLK1 and CLK ports
